channel.title: Tor Browser doesn't start after updates
channel.description:
Hi dear anon people!
I hope you are all doing well despite the pandemic.
I'm Whonix user since a year, find it better as Tails on USB stick.
But after latest updates the Tor Browser wont start, because input/output errors occurred.
I hope to solve the issue with an reinstall from Tor Browser, but same issue.
Does this problem have anything to do with the fact that the tb-updater package has been updated?
Because after clean install i updated first the browser before applying global updates. After restarting the browser same issue :confused:
After updates i see that SW Date doesn't work too on both!
Could someone enlighten me because I'm confused at this time.
I'm running under 15.0.0.9.4
Here the error output:
``` ############################################################################### ## msgdispatcher script bug. ## No panic. Nothing is broken. Just some rare condition has been hit. ## Try again later. There is likely a solution for this problem. ## Please see Whonix News, Whonix Blog and Whonix User Help Forum. ## Please report this bug! ## ## who_ami: user ## ## msgdisptacher_username: user ## msgdispatcher_identifier: torbrowser ## msgdispatcher_appendix: ## delete_wrapper: /usr/lib/msgcollector/msgdispatcher_delete_wrapper ## ## error_text: sudo --non-interactive msgdisptacher_username="$msgdisptacher_username" msgdispatcher_identifier="$msgdispatcher_identifier" msgdispatcher_appendix="messagex_done" "$delete_wrapper" ## last exit_code: 1 ############################################################################### ```

item.title: Tor Browser doesn't start after updates
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Try start Tor Browser in debugging mode

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser#In_Debugging_Mode

claudio.pedretto:

Does this problem have anything to do with the fact that the tb-updater package has been updated?

Unlikely.

claudio.pedretto:

After updates i see that SW Date doesn’t work too on both!

This needs a better error description. See:

whonix.org – 28 Mar 20

Bug Reports and Software Development - Whonix

How to Report (Security) Bugs in the Whonix ™ Operating System. Software development cycle, patches, and responsiveness to feedback.

Read full topic
item.source: Tor Browser doesn't start after updates

item.title: Tor Browser doesn't start after updates
item.dc:creator: claudio.pedretto
item.description:
After searching i found my issue

Don’t add user as root in sudoers file like this:

User privilege specification

root ALL=(ALL:ALL) ALL

Allow members of group sudo to execute any command

%sudo ALL=(ALL:ALL) ALL

See sudoers(5) for more information on “#include” directives:

#includedir /etc/sudoers.d
user ALL=(ALL:ALL) ALL #dont add this!!

Just let the file in original configuration.

Hope this can helping the community

Read full topic
item.source: Tor Browser doesn't start after updates

item.title: Tor Browser doesn't start after updates
item.dc:creator: claudio.pedretto
item.description:
Hi dear anon people!

I hope you are all doing well despite the pandemic.

I’m Whonix user since a year, find it better as Tails on USB stick.

But after latest updates the Tor Browser wont start, because input/output errors occurred.

I hope to solve the issue with an reinstall from Tor Browser, but same issue.

Does this problem have anything to do with the fact that the tb-updater package has been updated?

Because after clean install i updated first the browser before applying global updates. After restarting the browser same issue

After updates i see that SW Date doesn’t work too on both!

Could someone enlighten me because I’m confused at this time.

I’m running under 15.0.0.9.4

Here the error output:

############################################################################### 
## msgdispatcher script bug. 
## No panic. Nothing is broken. Just some rare condition has been hit. 
## Try again later. There is likely a solution for this problem. 
## Please see Whonix News, Whonix Blog and Whonix User Help Forum. 
## Please report this bug!

## who_ami: user 
## 
## msgdisptacher_username: user 
## msgdispatcher_identifier: torbrowser 
## msgdispatcher_appendix: 
## delete_wrapper: /usr/lib/msgcollector/msgdispatcher_delete_wrapper

## error_text: sudo --non-interactive msgdisptacher_username="$msgdisptacher_username" msgdispatcher_identifier="$msgdispatcher_identifier" msgdispatcher_appendix="messagex_done" "$delete_wrapper" 
## last exit_code: 1 
###############################################################################
